newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end flat after wavering narrowly.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end flat after wavering narrowly.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended nearly flat on Thursday after the key index teetered around the 20,000 barrier for most of session.
Brokers said the market was weighed down by profit-taking, but gained support from purchases of laggard issues, mainly by foreign investors.
The 225-share Nikkei average was 12.91 points or 0.06 percent higher at 20,061.81. June Nikkei futures were down 20 points at 20,060.
"Relatively cheap issues and some blue chips such as Sony Corp were bought actively," said Harushige Kobayashi, Yamaichi Securities deputy general manager.
Mitsubishi Chemical Corp shed 12 yen to 408 in trade which totalled 6.50 million shares, making it the fourth-most heavily traded stock.

A broker at a "Big Four" brokerage who was a large seller of Japan's largest comprehensive chemical maker said it was easy for profit-taking to emerge above the Nikkei average's 20,000 threshold, and recent high-flyers were the most vulnerable.
Toyota group firm Denso Corp fell despite news of a share repurchase plan announced on Wednesday. It lost 100 yen to finish at 3,030.
Investors had bought Denso on speculation, brokers said, and used the announcement as an excuse to sell.

By sector, services, land transport, miscellaneous manufacturers, automobiles and retailers were the main gainers. Rubber, securities, real estate, precision instruments and communications were at the top of the list of declining issues.
Brokers said the May options settlement on Friday was likely to pass fairly smoothly and the Nikkei average would not be affected much.
